CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Violation of Art. 13;Remainder inadmissible;Pecuniary and non-pecuniary damage, costs and expenses - financial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and currently resides in GPE . He is a former employee of ORG ” ( the “ CMP ” ) .
CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant instituted proceedings against the ORG in ORG of GPE , seeking the recovery of salary arrears .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of Odessa ordered the ORG to pay the applicant ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL in compensation . The decision was not appealed and became final on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG informed the applicant that the judgment in his favour could not be immediately executed due to the ORG ’s lack of funds . In particular , it noted that the ORG ’s debts amounted to ORG , including salary arrears in the amount of ORG CARDINAL . They also stated that they were in the course of selling some of the ORG ’s property and vessels belonging to it .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG informed the applicant that ORG had frozen the ORG ’s bank accounts , however they had been empty since DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant informed the ORG that the judgment had been executed when , on DATE , he had been paid ORG CARDINAL .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law is set out in the judgment of DATE in the case of ORG v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § § DATE ) .
